title: Ford and GM are rushing to build electric pickups — but why?
text:
Ford and GM are rushing to build electric pickups — but why? More

Large pickup trucks that tow most of the profits in to Ford and General Motors are holdovers from another century — with heavy ladder frames and big internal combustion engines in the front driving the wheels in the back. Now, Ford and GM are racing to design radical new takes on their most profitable models, replacing petroleum-fueled engines with batteries in a bid to outflank Tesla Inc's plan to eclipse their brands. Ford's F-150 pickup and GM's Chevrolet Silverado are the top selling vehicles in the U.S. market.
